subject: RE: [junit] Migrating JMock parameterized tests from Junit 3.8.1 to 4.5
msgSnippet: Steve, Sounds interesting. What s your first test case? Cheers, Kent Beck Three Rivers Institute _____ From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
Steve,

Sounds interesting. What's your first test case?

Cheers,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Steve Freeman
Sent: Monday, December 29, 2008 7:48 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Migrating JMock parameterized tests from Junit 3.8.1 to
4.5



Perhaps this is another opportunity to prod David. I've been saying
for a while that I'd like to be able to compose runners, it shouldn't
be that hard.

S.

On 11 Nov 2008, at 11:46, Nat Pryce wrote:
> 2008/11/11 James Abley <james.abley@ <mailto:james.abley%40gmail.com>
gmail.com>:
>> Is it a valid use case though, wanting to compose / mix runner
>> functionality?
>
> It is, but the JUnit API does not well support it yet.
>
> --Nat
